title: Can you transplant a head to another body? - Max G. Levy

title: How does an air conditioner actually work? - Anna Rothschild

multiple-choice.question: What is a heat pump, and how does it work?

options.label: C
options.text: A heat pump is a device that uses refrigerants to transfer heat from one location to another.

options.label: C
options.text: The word "dough" was originally pronounced "dough."

options.label: D

options.label: B
options.text: The way English speakers pronounced many consonants changed significantly.

options.label: C
options.text: The English language became more standardized.

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: Could AI predict the future? - Thomas Hofweber

multiple-choice.question: What is the main concern with the AI-based model that predicts the likelihood of divorce?

options.label: A
options.text: It is too expensive to use.

options.label: B
options.text: It doesn't offer any reasons for its results.

options.label: C
options.text: It only works for couples in their first marriage.

options.label: D
options.text: It has a low accuracy rate.

multiple-choice.question: What is the accuracy rate of the AI model in predicting divorce within the first five years of marriage?
What are the three options for a couple who receives a prediction that they will divorce within five years of getting married?

options.label: A
options.text: Get married anyway, break up now, or stay together and remain unmarried.

options.label: B
options.text: Get married anyway, stay together and remain unmarried, or try couples therapy.

options.label: C
options.text: Break up now, stay together and remain unmarried, or try to ignore the prediction.

options.label: D
options.text: Get married anyway, stay together and remain unmarried, or try to improve their relationship.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the tradeoffs of outsourcing important decisions to AI?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased accuracy.

options.label: B
options.text: Increased accountability.

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased accountability.

options.label: D
options.text: Increased transparency.

multiple-choice.question: Why is authenticity over accuracy important when making decisions about marriage?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it allows for more flexibility.

options.label: B
options.text: Because it allows for more control.

options.label: C
options.text: Because it allows for more accountability.

options.label: D
options.text: Because it allows for more authenticity.

multiple-choice.question: What is the potential risk of using the AI model to predict divorce?

options.label: A
options.text: That it will make predictions that are too optimistic.

options.label: B
options.text: That it will make predictions that are too pessimistic.

options.label: C
options.text: That it will create self-fulfilling predictions.

options.label: D
options.text: That it will not be accurate.

multiple-choice.question: What is the figure that means 1 in 20 couples will receive a false prediction from the AI model?

options.label: D
options.text: 1 in 20

title: What happened when these 6 dictators took over? - Stephanie Honchell Smith

multiple-choice.question: According to the legend of Cincinnatus, what was he doing when he received news that Rome's enemy, the Aequi, had invaded?

options.label: A
options.text: He was attending a meeting with the Roman Senate.

options.label: B
options.text: He was plowing his fields.

options.label: C
options.text: He was leading the Roman army in battle.

options.label: D
options.text: He was on a diplomatic mission to a neighboring country.

multiple-choice.question: What is the idea of a "benevolent dictator"?

options.label: A
options.text: A leader who holds absolute power and uses it for personal gain.

options.label: B
options.text: A leader who holds absolute power and uses it for the common good.

options.label: C
options.text: A leader who holds limited power and makes decisions based on public opinion.

options.label: D
options.text: A leader who holds no power and relies on advisors to make decisions.

multiple-choice.question: What are some of the characteristics of a dictatorship?

options.label: A
options.text: A strong legislative branch, a free press, and regular elections.

options.label: B
options.text: A single individual with absolute power, no checks on their authority, and a cult of personality.

options.label: C
options.text: A system of government where power is shared among multiple branches and institutions.

options.label: D
options.text: A system of government where the people have direct control over decision-making.

multiple-choice.question: What is the term for a type of authoritarianism that exalts the importance of one nation or race above all others?

options.label: A
options.text: Fascism.

options.label: B
options.text: Nationalism.

options.label: C
options.text: Communism.

options.label: D
options.text: Socialism.

multiple-choice.question: How did Benito Mussolini and Adolf Hitler initially gain popularity?

options.label: A
options.text: By promising to reduce the power of the state and increase individual freedoms.

options.label: B
options.text: By channeling economic woes into racist rhetoric and embracing fascism.

options.label: C
options.text: By promising to increase taxes and reduce government spending.

options.label: D
options.text: By promising to reduce the role of the military and increase diplomacy.

multiple-choice.question: What is the term for the practice of punishing dissenting voices and promoting loyalty over expertise?

options.label: A
options.text: Censorship.

options.label: B
options.text: Propaganda.

options.label: C
options.text: Authoritarianism.

options.label: D
options.text: Loyalism.

multiple-choice.question: What is the term for a leader who holds total power and uses it for the common good?

options.label: A
options.text: A benevolent dictator.

options.label: B
options.text: A tyrant.

options.label: C
options.text: A despot.

options.label: D
options.text: A monarch.

multiple-choice.question: According to the legend of Cincinnatus, what did he do after saving Rome from the Aequi?

options.label: A
options.text: He stayed in power and continued to rule Rome.

options.label: B
options.text: He stepped down and retired to his fields.

options.label: C
options.text: He was appointed as the Roman Emperor.

options.label: D
options.text: He was killed in battle.

multiple-choice.question: What is the term for the practice of building up a cult of personality by minimizing negative coverage and pushing positive propaganda?

options.label: A
options.text: Propaganda.

options.label: B
options.text: Censorship.

options.label: C
options.text: Authoritarianism.

options.label: D
options.text: Personality cult.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between a dictatorship and a democracy?

options.label: A
options.text: A dictatorship has a strong legislative branch, while a democracy has a weak one.

options.label: B
options.text: A dictatorship has a single individual with absolute power, while a democracy has a system of shared power.

options.label: C
options.text: A dictatorship has no checks on the leader's authority, while a democracy has many checks.

options.label: D
options.text: A dictatorship has a free press, while a democracy has a controlled one.

options.label: B

title: Picture a perfect society. What does it look like? - Joseph Lacey

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of the "veil of ignorance" in John Rawls' thought experiment?

options.label: D
options.text: Wealth inequalities are only acceptable when they are equal among all citizens.

options.label: A
